summary: This bill, the "Lower Drug Costs for Families Act," amends Title XVIII and 1860D of the Social Security Act to address prescription drug costs. It extends drug inflation rebates to the commercial market for both Part B and Part D drugs. The bill also changes the base year used for calculating these rebates, primarily shifting it back to 2016 from 2021. The effective dates for the changes vary, applying to calendar quarters on or after January 1, 2026, for Part B drugs, and applicable periods beginning on or after October 1, 2025, for Part D drugs.
